Project.title: Project
Project.description: Represents a proposal project that can be saved, edited, and shared.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Project entity.

name.description: The unique name of the project.

templateData.description: JSON data representing the filled template. This allows persistence of dynamic content.

tone.description: The tone of the proposal, determined by AI, e.g., formal, informal, technical.

brandingData.description: JSON data representing the branding configurations (company logo, color schemes).

definition.description: Stores project data owned by a specific user. Uses path-based ownership, enabling simple security rules based on the 'userId' and allows collaboration on the same projects by different specialists.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user who owns the project.

params.name: projectId
params.description: The unique identifier of the project.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to ensure authorization independence, clarity, and scalability for the PropoCraft application. It leverages path-based ownership for user-created projects, enabling secure and efficient data access. The design avoids using `get()` calls in security rules by denormalizing authorization data where necessary and uses structural segregation to enforce consistent security postures across collections.

The structure stores each project under its owner's document at `/users/{userId}/projects/{projectId}`. This approach naturally enforces ownership and simplifies security rules based on the requesting user's ID.  The `name` field must be unique. To ensure QAPs, we segregate user-owned data into user-specific subcollections.
